arm_group.description: Two sessions of acupuncture, at least twelve hours apart, post-mastectomy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of the study is to compare the effect of acupuncture to the standard of care
      (control group) on pain, nausea, anxiety, ability to cope, costs and length of hospital stay
      in post-mastectomy patients at Abbott Northwestern Hospital.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Trial to Assess the Impact of Acupuncture on Post-mastectomy Pain, Nausea, Anxiety and Ability to Cope

detailed_description.textblock:
About 40 subjects will be participating in this study.  Following qualification for the
      study, participants will be randomly assigned by chance to receive either acupuncture or to
      receive the standard of care without an integrative medicine session.

        -  One group will receive acupuncture after surgery.  Acupuncture involves inserting thin,
           sterile needles at certain points on your body.

        -  The other group will receive the standard of care without an acupuncture session.

      Before surgery participants will complete a demographics questionnaire.  After surgery,
      participants will be visited in their hospital room by either an acupuncturist or another
      member of the research team.  For those assigned to the acupuncture group, participants will
      receive up to two sessions of acupuncture, at least twelve hours apart.  For those assigned
      to the control group, a research team member will visit the participant in their room up to
      two times, at least twelve hours apart.  During those visits, participants will be asked
      about pain, nausea, anxiety, and ability to cope at the beginning and end of each treatment
      or visit.

      Additional information will be gathered from participants hospital charts, such as the type
      of surgery that was performed, length of hospital stay, and the costs associated with the
      hospital stay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Women

          -  18 years or older

          -  Undergoing mastectomy surgery

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Non-English speaking

          -  Pregnant

          -  Also undergoing an oophorectomy, TRAM or Latissimus flap surgery

intervention.description: Acupuncture involves inserting thin, sterile needles into the skin at certain points in the body.

clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Randomized Controlled Trial to Assess the Impact of Acupuncture on Post-mastectomy Pain, Nausea, Anxiety and Ability to Cope.

primary_outcome.description: Feasibility will be measured by the number of patients eligible for enrollment, the number approached, the number consented, and the final sample with completed data. The study population will be described in terms of demographics and background characteristics collected on the enrollment questionnaire.
primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients eligible compared to the number approached and enrolled

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Change in pain on an 11-point Pain Scale between pre-intervention and post-intervention at both baseline treatment and 12 hour treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed on post operations day 1 and 2 of their hospital stay

secondary_outcome.description: Change in anxiety on an 11-point Anxiety Scale between pre-intervention and post-intervention at both baseline treatment and 12 hour treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed on post operations day 1 and 2 of their hospital stay

secondary_outcome.description: Change in nausea on an 11-point Nausea Scale between pre-intervention and post-intervention at both baseline treatment and 12 hour treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed on post operations day 1 and 2 of their hospital stay

secondary_outcome.description: Change in ability to cope on an 11-point Coping Scale between pre-intervention and post-intervention at both baseline treatment and 12 hour treatment.
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ability to Cope Post Intervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed on post operations day 1 and 2 of their hospital stay

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
